senses.sense_definition: Eager to learn or know something; wanting to ask questions or investigate.

examples.text: Young children are naturally <w>curious</w> about the world and everything in it.
I was <w>curious</w> to see what was inside the large wooden box.

senses.sense_definition: Strange, unusual, or unexpected in a way that attracts interest.

examples.text: The platypus is a <w>curious</w> creature with fur like a mammal and a beak like a bird.
It is a <w>curious</w> thing that he never mentioned his brother before today.

senses.sense_definition: Showing or expressing a desire to know or learn something.

examples.text: He gave her a <w>curious</w> look when she mentioned the secret plan.
The doctor watched the patient with a <w>curious</w> expression on his face.

senses.sense_definition: Open to experimenting with romantic or sexual relationships outside of one's usual preference.

examples.text: He described himself as <w>curious</w> during his college years before settling down.
She admitted she was <w>curious</w> about dating women despite her previous history.
